# setButtonType(_:)

**Instance Method**

Sets how the button highlights while pressed and how it shows its state.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func setButtonType(_ type: NSButton.ButtonType)
```

## Parameters

- **type**: A constant specifying the type of button. This can be one of the constants defined in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/ButtonType].

## Discussion

The  [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButtonCell/setButtonType(_:)] method redisplays the button before returning.

The types available are for the most common button types, which are also accessible in Interface Builder; you can configure different behavior with the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButtonCell/highlightsBy] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButtonCell/showsStateBy] properties.

Note that there is no `-buttonType` method. The set method sets various button properties that together establish the behavior of the type.

## Related Documentation

- **image**: The image displayed by the cell, if any.
- **alternateImage**: The image the button displays in its alternate state.

## Displaying the Cell

- **highlightsBy**: A set of flags that indicate how the button highlights when it receives a mouse-down event (that is, when the button is pressed).
- **showsStateBy**: The flags that indicate how the button cell shows its alternate state.
